markdownRemark.html:
Never Enough came to me as a book that some people read as part of a discussion group at school. I just got around to reading it now even though that group was many months ago. I am glad I finally read it as it was a quick read and it was an interesting view into the culture of many "high pressure" school settings.

I don't think I grew up with that much pressure, I never felt "stress" to do well in school. But I did have some of the issues addressed here. I also see how it can be pretty toxic. It was very informative for what to look out for. The writing style got a little tired and the whole book could have probably been half as long, but I know that this is the normal style for this type of book. Definitely worth reading.
